item.description:
Hi, I (Andrew G) am giving Greg a break and leading this walk. It's a fun walk, and I've led a group on it before.

We'll meet at 10:30 am in the parking lot in front of Donelan's supermarket and the part of Lincoln commuter rail station adjacent to Donelans (the commuter rail station is on both sides of Lincoln Road). Donelans is located at 145 Lincoln Rd Lincoln, MA and is part of a gray, modern looking "strip mall." There is a large parking lot with plenty of spaces-I suggest parking in the back of the lot where the supermarket is. It is actually conceivable to take the T there (commuter rail-North Station to Fitchburg line - Lincoln stop) - see www.mbta.com for details - but I recommend getting a ride if you don't have a car (I can drive up to three people from Alewife).

The walk goes from Donelans/Lincoln Station to Walden Pond, and then back. It takes a tad over two hours. The walk goes through forests and fields, some up and down portions, a couple quiet streets to cross, and ends up at Walden Pond. I usually like to take a break at Walden Pond on one of the "beaches" and take in the beauty of the pond - and we can do that if poeple like. Then we walk back. Sneakers are fine, bring boots if it rains.

We'll then have lunch at a restaurant in Waltham center on Moody St. at Tom Can Cook (Asian) 374 Moody Street, Waltham; 781-891-6977.

[FYI, A NOTE THAT THIS IS EASTER SUNDAY]
item.name: Lincoln Station - Walden Pond Walk
